intro: Phagnalon denticulatum, commonly known as the toothed phagnalon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with finely toothed margins. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It is native to regions of southern Europe and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Phagnalon denticulatum is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
